Preview: College Rugby Tens Tournament

Freddy Harris takes us through the term's runners and riders for this year's College Rugby tens tournament (Thumbnail credit James key man Alex Muntus is held up in the recent College Final against Derwent)

Jubliant men's lacrosse team produce comeback to reach cup final

A decisive goal from York captain Phil Harrold secured York's place in the final of the men's Northern Conference Cup (Thumbnail credit Victory for York saw them exact revenge for a narrow loss against the same opposition just a week ago. Image: Peter Iveson)

Men's rugby firsts lose out to promotion rivals Manchester

York went agonisingly close to matching BUCS Northern Conference leaders Manchester on the 22 acres, losing 24-19 in a tight game that saw their impressive home record tarnished by defeat (Thumbnail credit York were just one try away from drawing against their title rivals in this bruising encounter)

Nouse Sport Podcast

By James Bithell

Another week, another Nouse Sport Podcast. The perfect accompaniment to that boring essay. Alternatively, pour yourself a deep bath, have a glass of wine and enjoy (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Sam Asfahani secures second year with comfortable victory in YUSU elections

Sam Asfahani has won a second year as York Sport President, fending off a spirited challenge from Ben McGladdery. Asfahani, the third YUSU incumbent to retain a sabbatical position in two years, will hope to utilise the mandate afforded to him by a formidable margin of victory to further his election pledges into 2012

Derwent march on but Goodricke sustain pressure on the league leaders

By James Bithell

Derwent furthered their title ambitions after they secured a hard-fought 1-0 win over a plucky James side (Thumbnail credit Team of the week: Nouse picks the eleven that made the difference for their respective colleges)

James undone by defiant Derwent

Derwent have confounded the received wisdom regarding college rugby by battling to superb 12-10 win over a usually imperious James side in the final of the collegiate rugby season (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

Darts team win national tournament

The University of York Darts Club travelled to Liverpool this weekend and secured a memorable victory in the UDUK University Cup finals day with a comprehensive 7-3 scoreline over Leeds University

Clinical Sabres batter York Centurions

A devastating second quarter performance from the visiting Sheffield Sabres halted York's quest for their first ever berth in the BUAFL Northern Conference Play-offs (Thumbnail credit The heavy defeat for the American footballers comes in the wake of their first ever victory just weeks ago against Hull. Photo: Philippa Grafton)

Behind the microphone

Sports Editor Henry Cowen talks to Guy Mowbray, BBC commentator and York native, about the pressures of his job and how well he really gets on with summariser Mark Lawrenson (Thumbnail credit Guy Mowbray is one of the BBC's top commentators and has come a long way since starting with Clubcall. Photo: BBC)

The Mixer at Elections

By James Bithell

The Mixer is happy to be the mouthpiece of the regime. It is our sole purpose to spout the carefully engineered propaganda put forward by the Asfahani administration (Thumbnail credit Be my Guest: Pure bromance as Guessfahani smile for the cameras. Photo: Peter Iveson)

Whole in one - world golf in a nutshell

Sam Morgan produces another blog on the goings-on in the world of golf (Thumbnail credit Image: Keith Allison via Flickr Creative Commons)

Semi-final heartbreak for men's fencers

The men's fencers went out of the BUCS Cup at the semi-final stage yesterday, losing 132-115 to the University of Birmingham (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Tom Clarke wonder goal earns men's football firsts a point

After their limp display in the Varsity festivities, Hull's footballers had the chance to reassert balance in this local rivalry in their BUCS Northern Conference fixture but a magnificent goal from Tom Clarke secured York a share of the points (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Late minute Milner goal gives women's football the points

York's women's footballers secured another win, this time overcoming Northumbria University by two goals to one (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Centurions finally triumphant over red rose rivals

The York Centurions triumphed over their Roses rivals the Lancaster Bombers for the first time on Sunday, winning a tight game 3-2 (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Big win over Sheffield Hallam keeps women's basketballers unbeaten

York's women basketballers racked up their eight win out of eight in the league this season as they seek promotion (Thumbnail credit Image: Jivan Mohanty)

Promotion prospects left in tatters for men's hockey seconds

York's poor run of form running into the end of the season continued as they lost their home fixture to third place Teesside to end any promotion aspirations (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Men's rugby seconds fight back to earn win over St. John

A last minute try from captain Jack Eastwood sealed a thrilling win for the men's rugby seconds over city rivals York St. John firsts yesterday afternoon (Thumbnail credit Image: Jivan Mohanty)

Men's firsts football take all the points against Hull

Goals from Ali Prince and Josh Baines sealed a 2-0 win for the men's football firsts on the second day of White Rose Varsity (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Men's badminton firsts romp home to 8-0 win

James Davies' badminton side beat the University of Hull firsts 8-0 and were also named York's Varsity Team of the Year (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Offord hat-trick seals 4-1 win for men's football seconds

A James Offord hat-trick secured a comfortable 4-1 win for the men's football seconds on a dominant day for York (Thumbnail credit Image: Lucy Dixon)

Hull earn rare wins in Ultimate Frisbee

Hull's Varsity team of the year, the Ultimate Frisbee team, secured two wins out of two on the second day of the White Rose Varsity (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Men's seconds badminton produce effortless win

The men's badminton seconds easily won 7-1 on the second day of Varsity to secure York three more points (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Classy Hull beat plucky York in basketball

There was a slight silver lining for Hull at Varsity as they won the men's firsts basketball 101-59 (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Varsity day two: As it happened

The Nouse Sport team bring you all the action from the second and final day of the inaugural White Rose Varsity

York enjoy best of the netball but Hull firsts seal glory in final match

By James Bithell

All three University of York netball teams, plus a Medics side, went up against their Hull rivals in the first day of Varsity action (Thumbnail credit Image: Lucy Dixon)

Medics share the spoils in two feisty encounters

The Hull Medics enjoyed the better of the Medics football, taking two points to York's one (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Women's footballers fire six again to hammer Hull

York's women's footballers enjoyed another brilliant day at the office, firing six past the University of Hull to earn four varsity points (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

College Barbarians undone by late University thirds try

A College Barbarians side conceded a last minute try and thus found themselves on the wrong side of a 15-13 scoreline in an exhibition fixture on the first day of White Rose Varsity (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Freddy Harris takes us through the term's runners and riders for this year's College Rugby tens tournament (Thumbnail credit James key man Alex Muntus is held up in the recent College Final against Derwent)
